Data Structures

Here are the data structures with brief descriptions:
Aftermath::ArmyAn Army is a number of TileGroupUnits that travel on land
Aftermath::Array2D< T >A generic, 2D array
Aftermath::Collection< T >Collection is a generic collection class for groups of objects
Aftermath::Count< T >A Count is just a mapping from elements to integers
Aftermath::DateDate is a NamedType representing a historical date
Aftermath::GameA class to represent an ongoing game's state
Aftermath::GameSettingsA GameSettings object holds all of the settings for a run of the game
Aftermath::IndustryAn Industry represents the production capabilities of a player
Aftermath::LaborLabor points represent manpower for use in manufacturing
Aftermath::LevelAn upgradable's level needs to hold certain information about the costs of aquiring that level
Aftermath::MerchantMarineMerchantMarine is the max amount of any one product type to be traded internationally per turn
Aftermath::ModA Mod is a pack of tiles, resources, nations, units, technologies, images, and more
Aftermath::MoneyMoney is used to purchase goods, technology, and upgrades
Aftermath::MoveMove is an entirely abstract interface for defining a type of move that can be applied to a Game
Aftermath::NamedTypeNamedType is a base class for all named types like resource types, unit types, and nations
Aftermath::NationNation objects are immutable and are reused from game to game
Aftermath::NavyA Navy is a number of TileGroupUnits that travel on water
Aftermath::PlayerA Player object represents a player of the game
Aftermath::ProductionCenterProductionCenters are upgradable centers of production
Aftermath::ProductionCenterTypeA ProductionCenterType is a type of ProductionCenter
Aftermath::ProductionFormulaProductionFormulas hold information about the requirements to produce a specified list of products (NamedTypes)
Aftermath::ProductionLevelA ProductionLevel is the Level of a ProductionCenter
Aftermath::ProvinceProvinces are TileGroups that are controlled by Players
Aftermath::ResourceA Resource is a type of good or raw material that can be harvested from Tiles or manufactured from other resources
Aftermath::SeaSeas are TileGroups that are without owners and without capitals
Aftermath::SelectiveCollection< T >A SelectiveCollection is a type of collection that decides whether or not to accept its elements
Aftermath::SpecialistTypeA SpecialistType is the role of a TileUnit
Aftermath::TechnologyA Technology is a technological advance researched by a Player
Aftermath::TechnologyTreeA TechnologyTree keeps track of what technologies a player has researched and what technologies a player can research
Aftermath::TerrainA Terrain object represents a particular class of Tile, e.g
Aftermath::TileTile objects are what game maps are made out of
Aftermath::TileActionA TileAction is an action performed on a Tile by a TileUnit
Aftermath::TileGroupTileGroups are a named collections of Tiles
Aftermath::TileGroupUnitA TileGroupUnit is a unit that travels across TileGroups
Aftermath::TileMapA TileMap is a map of tiles, each belonging to a TileGroup
Aftermath::TileUnitA TileUnit is an instance of a SpecialistType that is owned by a Player
Aftermath::TransferableTransferable is an interface for something that can be given to or taken from a player or is conditionally able to prevent or enable production
Aftermath::TransportCapacityTransportCapacity is the capacity of a TransportNetwork to transport goods
Aftermath::TransportNetworkA TransportNetwork handles all of the resources connected to a player's capital by their network of railroads and ports
Aftermath::TreatyThe diplomatic relationship between two players
Aftermath::UnitLevelA UnitLevel is the level of a TileGroupUnit
Aftermath::UnitTypeA UnitType is an immutable type of TileGroupUnit
Aftermath::Upgradable< LevelType >An Upgradable object can be upgraded by a Player for the proper amount of Resources and money
Aftermath::WorkerTypeA WorkerType is a type of laborer that can work for a Player to manufacture products using labor
